process_details.description: The Manage Case Information business process maintains and updates information related to care management cases throughout the case lifecycle. This process ensures that case records are current, accurate, and accessible to authorized users for care coordination and decision-making.
trigger_events: New information received about member or case.
Request for case information from authorized user.
results: Updated case record with current information.
Case information available to authorized users.
Case history and audit trail maintained.
Notifications sent for significant case changes.
Reports generated for case management oversight.
process_steps: START: Receive case information update or request.
Validate user authorization to access or update case.
Review information for accuracy and completeness.
Update case record with new information.
Document source and date of information.
Maintain case history and audit trail.
Check for triggers requiring notifications or actions.
Make updated information available to authorized users.
process_details.constraints: Case information must be maintained in compliance with HIPAA privacy and security requirements. Access to case information is restricted to authorized users based on role and need. Case records must be retained according to state and federal record retention requirements.
failures: Unauthorized access attempt to case information.
Information update conflicts with existing data.
System unavailable for case information access.
performance_measures: User satisfaction with case information access
